p: To investigate the roles of endogenous UL42 in innate antiviral response to HCMV, we constructed two UL42-shRNA plasmids that could specifically knock down the expression of UL42, but not other HCMV genes ( Fig 2A). qPCR analysis indicated that knockdown of UL42 promoted HCMV- but not HSV-1-induced transcription of IFNB1, ISG56, ISG54, CXCL10, and IL6 genes at 6, 12, and 24 hr post-infection in HFFs ( Fig 2B). These results suggest that UL42-deficiency promotes innate antiviral response.
